title: Pair from Brighton facing charges in string of handicap placard thefts
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Andrea Doucette-Keating, 55, and Zachary Shelton, 37, were arrested in Brighton for theft of handicap placards.
Police linked Doucette-Keating to thefts at 82 Glenville Ave, 95 Washington St, and 34 Fidelis Way in Allston-Brighton.
Authorities found stolen placards, cocaine, and a Glock-style BB gun in Shelton's residence on Commonwealth Ave.

title: Why did the Patriots abandon the run against the Raiders? Mike Vrabel explains.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots abandoned their running game against the Raiders, opting for 46 passing attempts from quarterback Drake Maye.
Running backs TreVeyon Henderson, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Antonio Gibson combined for only 60 rushing yards on 18 carries.
Coach Mike Vrabel attributed the lack of running game success to ineffective offensive line play and a one-dimensional offensive strategy.

title: The T’s ‘fare engagement representatives’ are hitting the streets today. Here’s what to expect.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: MBTA fare engagement representatives begin enforcement with warnings and fines for fare evasion starting September 8, 2025.
First-time fare evasion offenders receive a warning; subsequent offenses incur $50 to $150 fines.
Massachusetts decriminalized fare evasion in 2021, but MBTA still struggles with fare collection issues.

title: Kendrick Bourne reportedly agrees to one-year contract with 49ers
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Kendrick Bourne, 30, signs a one-year deal with the 49ers worth up to $5 million.
Bourne was cut by the Patriots in August to pursue opportunities for more playing time.
Bourne initially started his NFL career with the 49ers as an undrafted free agent in 2017.

title: The Ocean Club restaurant opens in Martha’s Vineyard landmark bank building
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The Ocean Club restaurant opened on August 27 in the former Martha's Vineyard National Bank building in Vineyard Haven.
Award-winning chef Marc Orfaly leads the restaurant, which features a seasonal menu focused on seafood and pasta.
The historic building's original features were preserved, including a transformed vault now serving as a 10-seat wine cellar.

title: Saving pamphlets, receipts, and wrappers: Young people take on junk journaling
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Junk journaling, a modern scrapbooking trend, involves using paper receipts, wrappers, and found items as creative journal entries.
Lauren Clark, owner of Found and Flowered, hosts workshops promoting junk journaling as a hands-on, analogue hobby in Greater Boston.
Junk journaling appeals broadly, offering community through workshops and online, particularly among Millennials and Gen Z participants.

title: Review & setlist: My Chemical Romance skewers fascism at Fenway Park
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: My Chemical Romance performed at Fenway Park on September 7, 2025, during their 'Long Live The Black Parade' tour.
The band delivered a theatrical show exploring themes of authoritarianism, with actors and staged scenarios evoking fascist regimes.
Gerard Way and the band played their 2006 album in its entirety, followed by a set of additional songs post-intermission.

title: After serial shoplifters swipe $18K in sunglasses at Faneuil Hall store, police issue request for tips
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Serial shoplifters stole $18,000 worth of sunglasses from a Faneuil Hall Sunglass Hut across seven incidents.
The thefts at Sunglass Hut occurred between June 7 and August 25, all between 2 and 4:30 p.m.
Boston Police request public tips to identify suspects, encouraging anonymous reports via phone or text.

title: Boy, 14, shot in Brockton
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was shot in Brockton near Francis Street and Manners Avenue on Sunday evening.
The victim was taken to a local hospital with nonlife-threatening injuries following the shooting.
A silver vehicle was spotted fleeing the scene; the investigation by Brockton police is ongoing.

title: Feds arrest 171 suspected members of drug cartel in New England, including 49 in Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: The DEA arrested 171 suspected Sinaloa Cartel members in New England, including 49 in Massachusetts, during August operations.
The nationwide operation resulted in 617 arrests and the seizure of over $11 million, 420 firearms, and various drugs.
Seizures in New England included 244 kilograms of drugs, 22,115 counterfeit pills, $1.3 million, and 33 guns, according to the DEA.
